22617.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"4f0fh","text":"Wash hermaphrodites off plate with several ml of M9 solution and transfer to 15ml falcon tube (Fisher Scientific-Falcon 352096)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"6gje6","text":"Fill falcon tube up to 15ml with M9 solution","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"eodli","text":"Centrifuge for 2 minutes at 1500 rpm (RCF:210, ascending 9; descending 7) – program 1","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"408q1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"edr02","text":"Program 1 retains the worms as pellets and the bacteria is suspended as the supernatant","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"beln7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5ua7c","text":"The descending is slow as the worm pellet is lose at this stage which we don't want to break","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"brvgo","text":"Remove supernatant using a plastic Pasteur pipette taking care not to disturb pellet","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"8f130","text":"Leave atleast 0.5ml M9 to avoid disturbing the pellet","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"36rit","text":"Fill the tube with M9 upto 15ml","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"4h9b5","text":"Spin program 1","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"3k1sq","text":"Repeat steps 4-6 ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":17}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8jndd","text":"On final wash remove as much supernatant as possible and add M9 upto 4ml","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a8ln5","text":"Add 4ml 2X Bleach solution  (From here onwards try to work as quickly as possible to avoid over-exposure of the worms  to the bleach)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"d6pj9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"bokll","text":"USE FRESHLY PREPARED BLEACH EVERYTIME","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":37}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1lk6t","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":19,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"a90u5","text":"2X Bleach solution:","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"cssea","text":" ","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"3j2c7","text":"5% Sodium hypochlorite solution - 4ml","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"2qb43","text":"Sterile water - 3.5 ml","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"bkrpr","text":"1M NaOH solution - 2.5 ml","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"1ites","text":"TOTAL - 10 ml","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"62r2v","text":"Vortex on maximum setting for 4 min (no more as this will damage the eggs) ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6qu9k","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"8a6od","text":"Makesure the vortex forms ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"61r7h","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"etoc6","text":"After vortexing, top up the tube with M9 till 15ml","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cahme","text":"Centrifuge for 2 mins at 2500rpm (RCF:590, ascending 9; descending 7) – program 2","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"cj03q","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"70c74","text":"(Always check the program on the centrifuge before using it)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7khv7","text":"Remove supernatant by pouring into waste bottle – pellet should be compact and yellow in colour at bottom of falcon, but be careful not to lose","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"bm3b6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"f2u92","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"65rd8","text":"Add 15ml M9","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"48ltj","text":"Centrifuge at program 2","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e2rd9","text":"Repeat steps 12-14 four more times","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"e54tp","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"46ji2","text":"The number of washes is crucial here as we need to get rid of all the bleach","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9mqmn","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dgjjt","text":"After final wash add 15ml M9 and store eggs/larvae in the falcon on the rotator that is constantly spinning at 20oC, until feeding  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":113,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"43o4r","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"4i5o4","text":"L1 arrested larvae can be starved for up to 5 days before refeeding","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"7p1in","text":"Centrifuge larvae on program 2 to pellet","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"gjoo","text":"Remove supernatant with plastic Pasteur pipette","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1h9rc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"a1qu2","text":"The pellet is lose here so makesure not to disturb it","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"7nji7","text":"Add 15ml M9, spin to wash","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"75gje","text":"On final wash leave 0.5ml M9 in falcon","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"2qb4g","text":"Resuspend the pellet by gently tapping the tube/flicking it","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cirps","text":"Place droplet containing larvae onto seeded plate and allow to grow to desired developmental state (ie. 2 days for L4s, 2.5 days for young adults)  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"ahtqn","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5ngug","text":"Use glass pipette to place the droplet onto seeded plate, avoid using plastic pipette as larvae will stick to 24101.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"51doc","text":"Insert large cassette into the machine ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4m0e7","text":"Configure X, Y, and Z settings for the multiwell plate by clicking on tool symbol -\u003e stage alignment.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"161a0","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"54ihu","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"ekfnd","text":"For UNIPLATE96SQWLF 650U:","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"1ka4l","text":"\n","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"b3cpf","text":"X = 95.6","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"1t6n","text":"Y = 4.2","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"1c5oj","text":"Z = -22.5","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"cimvt","text":"\n","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"ao756","text":"For 48WP:","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{},"guid":"A6DDC0D1C24A44B2B2BFB9F33059154E"}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"408bt","text":"Exit settings by pressing the back button","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ed30p","text":"Press on the program you wish to use (see later for configuring your own program)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"devtr","text":"Make sure that the correct cassette is listed and change if necessary","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2jpm6","text":"Select the volume you wish to dispense","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"urjb","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"11hld","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"9a5eh","text":"For 96WP:","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"53qop","text":"150 μL","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"5gusm","text":"","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{},"guid":"B07A8121822E40D68BD8FD09A5FA1C05"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"33vs9","text":"Prepare a 250ml bottle of hot milliQ water in the microwave and keep in the waterbath along with the agar. The water is important to have on hand in case of tubing blockages.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7vkc8","text":"Put the plate into the stage and then press 'Move' so that the plate moves so that it is under the dispensing cassette. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b8cum","text":"Use the up and down arrows to move the pipette tip so that they hover just over the plate and make note of the height (this will be entered into the dispensing program at a later step). Press 'Fast/Slow' button to switch between fast and slow movements.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fjhcv","text":"Use the X, Y arrows to move the plate so that the pipette tips are centered in the middle of column 5.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"dp8b9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"cqqpg","text":"Save all settings.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c3cuh","text":"Place the end of the tubing from the casettee into the agar that is being kept warm in the water bath","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5shbd","text":"Press 'Prime' to prime the tubing and allow to finish so that agar flows from the pipette tips.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"7ers0","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"eflmm","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"2qvfo","text":"IMPORTANT:","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"j6hg","text":"Once the agar is in the tubing it is important to act quickly to avoid agar solidifying and causing blockages. If you are particularly concerned about agar cooling in the tubing, wrap the tubing in aluminium foil to keep hot.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{},"guid":"62901AC305B2492EBBE3C621A69A2D54"}}}}

cases.title: Unblocking the tubing
cases.description: {"blocks":[{"key":"5j1a2","text":"If the tubing does block, clear the blockage by 'reverse priming' as much of the agar as possible.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3v61","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1dpkc","text":"Then place tube ends in the hot water and prime continuously with hot water until the water runs all the way through.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b05rb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ceof","text":"If you are having trouble getting the water through, squeeze and massage parts of the tubing where you can see blockages to force the agar along and allow the water to pass.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a5sme","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"r489","text":"Once all cleared, 'reverse prime', and reprime with the agar","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

24101.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"f5i8r","text":"Select 'set height' and set the appropriate height for tip height (usually all the same)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"86cme","text":"Place a clean plate in the stage","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"ej3s","text":"Press run and then plate should fill with agar","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9o0bu","text":"Repeat steps 11-12 until all the plates have been filled.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"97j18","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"25sir","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"c4eh","text":"Little drops of agar can solidify on the tip ends. It is often good to remove these drops using a pipette tip every few runs so that blockages do not occur. ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{},"guid":"1F040B0FCB02461C95157A10E84A3BAE"}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"83lh","text":"'Reverse prime' all the agar","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"1tkvv","text":"Place the tubing ends into the hot water.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"2qk6v","text":"Prime so that the water runs through and clears all the agar","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"fhse3","text":"Reverse prime to remove the water","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"7dvv5","text":"Release tension from the tubing and remove cassette","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"8vp46","text":"Double wrap the cassette in aluminium foil for autoclaving","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

way)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"45f2h","text":" Prime the tubes by: Setup-\u003e Prime -\u003e Accept (Leave it on for few mins till the tubes get warm), Press Accept to stop Prime. Priming is very important to make the tubes warm and to avoid the agar being solidified.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"7qk4q","text":"Be careful not to touch the ends of the tube.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8ovo8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"8s1d8","text":" Place the nozzle perpendicluarly on top of the centre of the plate and press the foot pedal letting the agar to flow","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"74qb1","text":" If some agar spills on the surface wipe it off with a paper towel after it solidifies","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"b8qlp","text":" When taking a pause of more than 1min put the pump back to prime","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"aqvin","text":" When one bottle finishes, place the nozzle in the new bottle and prime to suck out the residual agar into the next bottle to prevent wastage (Wash the empty bottle and get some hot water in it)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9j6il","text":" Put both openings into the new bottle and prime again","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"3pk35","text":"When you reach the end of the second/last bottle stop pouring and discard the residual agar in the waste bucket","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2958j","text":" After pouring, wash the tubing (Prime) by passing  hot water from the clean bottle to the other one (to remove any agar in the tube)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"3jp1r","text":" Followed by priming air into the tubing making sure no liquid is remaining","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"4nk54","text":" Discard any agar in the waste bucket, wash the bottles and put them in the grey box in the lab","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9ok2k","text":" Close all switches in the hood","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"4sn5u","text":" Return the pump","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9lt96","text":"Clean the hood for the next user","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"b37es","text":" Wrap and label the tube 2x in aluminium foil, label it with tube size and lab room number (eg 8mm Tubing R5020) and take it to the media kitchen to put in the autoclave basket (Collect the tube the following day)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"730la","text":" Order agar in the media kitchen for the next pouring day (i.e. Every other Monday)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9a1u","text":" Let the plates solidify under the hood about an hour, label them with the date poured and then store them in the cold room upside down","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"f0m24","text":"On the same day of the pouring, measure the weights of 3 random poured plates with lids on from the stack and add to the plate weight data file in the shared folder","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4kpg4","text":" For pouring maintenance/imaging Petri dishes: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"958be","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1sjgt","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"protocols","mutability":"","data":{"authors":[{"affiliation":"Imperial College London","affiliation_url":"http://behave.lms.mrc.ac.uk/","image":{"placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/pr-journal/86b3npn.jpg","source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/pr-journal/86b3npn.jpg","webp_source":""},"is_verified_author":null,"is_verified_user":null,"link":"https://www.researchgate.net/profile/Priota_Islam","name":"Priota  Islam","note":null,"username":"priota-islam"}],"creator":{"name":"Priota Islam","username":"priota-islam"},"doi":"dx.doi.org/10.17504/protocols.io.uimeuc6","doi_status":2,"fork_id":0,"guid":"3405B770C45B11EBB3C53BF31CB850C4","has_subprotocols":0,"id":16685,"image":{"placeholder":"https://www.protocols.io/img/default_protocol.png","source":"https://www.protocols.io/img/default_protocol.png","webp_placeholder":null,"webp_source":null},"stats":null,"title":"Plate Pouring","title_html":"Plate Pouring","type_id":1,"uri":"plate-pouring-uimeuc6","version_data":{"code":"uimeuc6","has_approved_merge_request":false,"has_pending_merge_request":false,"id":0,"is_parent_public":false,"is_same_owner":false,"merge_request":null,"parent_id":null,"parent_uri":null,"version_class":16685}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dod1c","text":"Book the autoclave via the notebook on top of the machine. It will take around 2 hours for a 500ml bottle and 2.5 hours for 1L or larger bottles.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bbi29","text":"Take clean bottles and measuring cylinders from the glass kitchen - you will also need one bottle for the autoclave probe, which should be the size of the largest bottle you are autoclaving. Get sterile water from the media room.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a997q","text":"Measure out all the pre-autoclave reagents and add to the bottle. Use a new weighing boat and spatula for each reagent. Add water last and mix thoroughly.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"fclbp","text":"Add equivalent amount of water to the empty probe bottle.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3u64q","text":"Make sure the lid of your media bottle is not screwed completely when placing it inside the autoclave machine. Label with autoclave tape (‘NGM agar Rm 5020’), and place over the lid to prevent it coming off in the autoclave.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"8nobp","text":"Turn ON the autoclave and touch the screen","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2k7m1","text":"If 'Fill with water' is on the screen, fill up the autoclave with sterile water until it reaches the grill/'Water Level OK' appears on the screen.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"uq4o","text":"Place the probe bottle inside the autoclave with the temperature probe inside.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d3i42","text":"Place the bottles in the autoclave and make sure that the cap is not screwed completely.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"5j85u","text":"Check the waste flask is not too full","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"41uhd","text":"Close the door","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"enme3","text":"(On the screen) LOCK --\u003e START --\u003e MEDIA 121X15 BALLAST --\u003e Start","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"1m38o","text":"When autoclave is finished, UNLOCK the door","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"70nmc","text":"Remove the probe and media bottles using gloves (the bottles will be hot)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"83vj5","text":"Leave the agar on a lab bench to cool to around 55°C, ie the bottle is cool enough to hold for a second with a gloved hand","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"b8rjf","text":"Add the post autoclave reagents","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cont4","text":"Try not to shake the bottle too much while mixing to avoid air bubbles.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"apvnh","text":"The agar needs to be warm to be poured without blocking the tubings, so try to pour as quickly as possible and if not poured immediately put the bottle on a waterbath set to 60C until being used.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

50531.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"av8j1","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"4d1lk","text":" Turn on the compressor at the wall – it should show a pressure of 40psi after switched on","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"ftkhd","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"1nvjl","text":"Turn on equipment in the following order","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"527md","text":"a.Sorter (left side of unit near bottom)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"f4apc","text":"b.Computer and monitor","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"2in5f","text":"c.Laser, located under computer","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6u4kv","text":"d.Vacuum pump (switch on wall to right of sorter)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"imageblock","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"1C321D1EC76E11EB90790A58A9FEAC02","height":"291","is_video":false,"mime":null,"original_name":null,"placeholder":null,"source":null,"width":"598"}},"1":{"type":"image","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"589A0170C76E11EB9EEE05DF744365A3","height":301,"id":114487,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"Screenshot 2021-06-07 at 09.56.24.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/dr33bipyx.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/dr3zbipyx.jpg","webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/dr32bipyx.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/dr3ybipyx.webp","width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8fgqq","text":"Discard waste contents that are in the recovery cup (small shallow cup on the left-hand side of the machine)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"a1jd0","text":"a.Check/clean the recovery cup filter","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"fdm7h","text":"b.Replace filter ~once per week with a new cell strainer (it should clip into place)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a6h9u","text":"Check that there is water in the sheath. If the water is low (less than 5cm above the top of the green sensor), fill up withsterile H2O (from 4thfloor kitchen)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":124,"length":35},{"style":"sub","offset":133,"length":1},{"style":"sup","offset":143,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"828es","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"2rjm3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"276oj","text":"Make sure that the recovery cup and sample cup are securely tightened so that there are no leaks in the system","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"7btqh","text":"Check that there is sterile water in the sample cup","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5pp98","text":"Check for stray plate lids etc in the area around the COPAS stage and remove","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"332j6","text":"Open dbgview – should always be running in the background","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d4qjh","text":"Open FlowPilot software:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"88eko","text":"a.File -\u003e Load Experiment","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"bvadt","text":"i.Select appropriate template experiment from Documents/BehaviouralGenomics (adults, L4s, L2s all have different gates set)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6caaa","text":"b.File -\u003e Load sample (will load the sample with the appropriate gate for your experiments)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1j5h4","text":"Save your experiment for this day of sorting (YYYYMMDD_experimentname)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"dobef","text":"Save sample (adults/L4s etc)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"vkmv","text":"Check that the pressures are all okay (bottom left of software screen):","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"3kdhn","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"2arf","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"246fm","text":"CompartmentPressure (psi)Sheath~2.6Sample cup~1.6Diverter6Cleaning4","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":67}],"data":[]},{"key":"emcvk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"20ata","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"tables","mutability":"","data":{"cellsMeta":{"0_0":"","0_1":"","1_0":"","1_1":"","2_0":"","2_1":"","3_0":"","3_1":"","4_0":"","4_1":""},"colTitles":[],"colWidths":[126,99],"data":[["\u003cb\u003eCompartment\u003c/b\u003e","\u003cb\u003ePressure (psi)\u003c/b\u003e"],["Sheath","~2.6"],["Sample cup","~1.6"],["Diverter","6"],["Cleaning","4"]],"guid":"E93C3535C76E11EB90790A58A9FEAC02","isJexcelDataFormat":true,"legend":"","mergeCells":[],"printData":[["\u003cb\u003eCompartment\u003c/b\u003e","\u003cb\u003ePressure (psi)\u003c/b\u003e"],["Sheath","~2.6"],["Sample cup","~1.6"],["Diverter","6"],["Cleaning","4"]],"rowHeights":[]}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"cb4ag","text":"Maintenance -\u003e Flush Sample","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2o0q","text":"Click ‘Refill Sample’ – the sample cup pressure should decrease. You can see this in the software on the left hand size (include screenshot).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"didlp","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"3a3ae","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"7j3jt","text":"Sometimes the sample cup pressure doesn’t decrease and in fact increases. You can still unscrew the sample cup but if this persists there may be a blockage.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8s8ur","text":"Unscrew sample cup and replace with 50ml falcon filled with 50ml 20% Decon-90 (D901-04; dilute in sterile water)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"7jp0p","text":"Once securely replaced click ‘Done refill’","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8upab","text":"Check ‘Sample on’ and ‘mixer on’ – Decon solution should now pass through the system; allow a 50 ml to pass through (make sure sheath is unchecked)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9k0us","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"9ib8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"93ald","text":"You will get a warning about contaminating the flow cell, this normal and you can click 'Yes'","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"8f7of","text":"Uncheck ‘Sample on’ or click Abort to stop sample flow.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6pv62","text":"Repeat steps 13-17 with cleaning solution (Product Number: 300-5072-000; pink in colour) but only pass 10ml through the system","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2gicm","text":"Repeat steps 13-17 with a falcon filled with 50ml sterile water (from 4thfloor kitchen) and pass \u003e25ml through the system","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":71,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"dp77u","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ek018","text":"Hold an empty 50ml faclon under the sample dispenser (otherwise you will end up with a puddle of water on the COPAS!)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"ap2a6","text":"Maintenance -\u003e Flow check","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"agfoi","text":"Allow the water to flow into the falcon tube for the full 60 seconds","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"r0ot","text":"Record volume in the COPAS logsheet (Volumes/behavgenom$/Documentation/Protocols/COPAS_wormsorter/COPAS_logs/COPAS_logbook.xlsx)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5kfnn","text":"a.Aim for flow of 25ml/minute","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3c8r6","text":"Prepare 8mL solution of 1X control particles (Product number: 310-5071-001; 2 mL 4X stock solution, 6mL sterile water; label tube with date and wrap in foil to keep in the dark) – to be prepared once per week ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"3d2du","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"48jo1","text":"Set up -\u003e Control Particles","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"foiau","text":"Acquire","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"7qo46","text":"Adjust Sample Cup pressure so that you have 10-20 events/sec","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ctn7","text":"Aim for TOF Cv around 10-15% and tight narrow peak for TOF and Extinction ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6lf7m","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"ac317","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"88u64","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"DE74DCB0C76F11EB9EEE05DF744365A3","height":327,"id":114491,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"Picture 1.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/dr37bipyx.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/dr35bipyx.jpg","webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/dr36bipyx.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/dr34bipyx.webp","width":485}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4ic8e","text":"Record TOF and Extinction mean and cv in Volumes/behavgenom$/Documentation/Protocols/COPAS_wormsorter/COPAS_logs/COPAS_logbook.xlsx","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6kq19","text":"Take a screenshot of the control particles screen and save into Documents/BehaviouralGenomics/ControlParticles","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6a4gs","text":"a.Print Screen","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1bt0g","text":"b.Open Paint","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"c2gln","text":"c.Ctr + v","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"4ejoa","text":"d.Save","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"ca8hk","text":"Set up -\u003e control particles to exit","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fr23f","text":"Refill sample with sterile water, run 10 mL water. You are now ready to load your sample","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"emqh9","text":"Refill sample","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"240nc","text":"Gently swirl falcon with worms and screw into sample cup","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"7826u","text":"Done refill","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3kese","text":"Turn mixer ON. If you do not do this you may lose all your worms that have settled to the bottom of the tube!!!","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":13}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6g6cb","text":"Maintenance -\u003e Prime Flow Cell; to flush sample through the system and remove air bubbles","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"c357v","text":"Maintenance -\u003e Flush sample","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"8hqf3","text":"Check 488nm (and 568nm) laser boxes","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"93r3d","text":"Check ‘Use sort gate’ for stored sort gate ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1fdpk","text":"Click ‘Acquire’ – sample should pass through the system and number of events per second will be shown:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1hkr5","text":"a.Aim for 5-20 events per second","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"ahhfn","text":"b.If too few/too many events increase/decrease ‘Sample cup pressure’ so that it is between 1.5-2psi","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9psod","text":"c.Gate recovery should be between 20-50% ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"dng6","text":"d.To ensure only one event per droplet go to Setup-\u003eCoincidence, select ‘Pure, no double’. This increases accuracy in the number of worms dispensed but the time to dispense may increase.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"d7ivh","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"ap4fe","text":"Click on the plate icon on the top bar","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"mlt3","text":"Select number of objects to sort","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7n17k","text":"Select the wells you would like to fill (for testing we use a spare 60mm plate and fill wells A1, A2, B1, B2)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"c9qmr","text":"Select which gate to use (R4)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"dch5e","text":"Apply","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7u7k3","text":"Place 60mm plate in front left corner of left-hand stage with A1 in the left corner.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"2g0ur","text":"Click ‘Fill plate’ (the sheath will automatically turn on)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"6c6mb","text":"Keep an eye on the number of events per second","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"6sik0","text":"Ensure the ‘Diverter pressure’ is checked","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cljfn","text":"Check under microscope that the correct number of objects were dispensed per ‘well’","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"brb6p","text":"If too many objects, decrease sample cup pressure and repeat steps 8-11 or select Pure no double to increase accuracy.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"59t6k","text":"Click on the plate icon on the top bar","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"9ism8","text":"‘Clear plate’","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"mcv","text":"Select number of objects per well and click ‘Apply to All’ or select which wells you would like to fill.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"d7dhm","text":"Apply","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"b56bj","text":"Place 96 well plate in left-hand stage (A1 aligned)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8egts","text":"Ensure ‘Diverter pressure’ is checked’; if it is not then liquid comes out of the dispenser constantly and you get flooding.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"7jg5m","text":"‘Fill plate’","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6cu80","text":"Each time you do a dispense, save the file in the convention: YYYYMMDD_strain_ _platenumber in Documents/yourname/experimentname/date (eg. 20210211_PHX1675_S01R01)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cmi3c","text":"Keep an eye on the number of events per second still and monitor how much sample fluid is coming through the system","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"5mrl","text":"Repeat steps 13-19","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7chi1","text":"Keep sample cup with 50ml water in the falcon secured so that the system is air-tight and closed","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"3ntsk","text":"Empty recovery cup and waste bottle on floor","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ed979","text":"Remove waste tray (see below), unscrew, and empty and spray with water","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"7of7i","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6i2jg","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"jkil","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"9C7B8F60C77011EB9EEE05DF744365A3","height":247,"id":114495,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"Picture 3.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/dr4bbipyx.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/dr39bipyx.jpg","webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/dr4abipyx.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/dr38bipyx.webp","width":341}}}}

description: {"blocks":[{"key":"br9sn","text":"Protocol for tracking the behaviour of mutant (cua-1[H828Q], Wilson's Disease ortholog) vs wild-type (N2) worms: in the absence of treatment; exposed to 25-100uM CuCl₂ for 4h; reared for one generation on NGM+CuCl₂ plates (F1s); and reared for two generations on NGM+CuCl₂ plates (F2s).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

entries.section: Pour 150mm nursery plates (up to 6 days prior to tracking)

steps.section: Pick L4 worms for bleaching (9 days prior to tracking)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"c2s3l","text":"Pick 10 x L4 worms onto 10 x 90mm NGM-agar plates pre-seeded with E. coli OP50 for each strain to be tested. In this protocol we are comparing the response of a mutant strain containing a H828Q mutation in the cua-1 gene, cua-1[H828Q], to WT control (N2). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":66,"length":7},{"style":"italic","offset":210,"length":5}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7n1q3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5pf83","text":"Therefore 20 x 90 mm plates will be picked in total. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Pour 150mm nursery plates (up to 6 days prior to tracking)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"16e5q","text":"Prepare 4.5L NGM-agar and autoclave.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dlnpg","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"3k1aq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"protocols","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"id":50463,"title":"Making normal NGM","title_html":"\u003cp\u003eMaking normal NGM\u003c/p\u003e","load_collapsed":true,"uri":"making-normal-ngm-bvh7n39n","image":{"source":"https://www.protocols.io/img/default_protocol.png","webp_source":null,"placeholder":"https://www.protocols.io/img/default_protocol.png","webp_placeholder":null},"creator":{"name":"Bonnie Evans","affiliation":null,"affiliation_url":null,"username":"bonnie-evans","link":"","image":{"source":"/img/avatars/013.png","placeholder":"/img/avatars/013.png","webp_source":""}},"stats":{"number_of_steps":20},"type_id":1,"guid":"26AE19A0E37B11EDAFFC29FF651848A3"}}}}

steps.section: Pour 150mm nursery plates (up to 6 days prior to tracking)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"hj61","text":"Meanwhile prepare a 1 M stock solution of copper chloride (CuCl₂) by dissolving 134.45mg of powder in 1mL of sterile deionised water.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aaiir","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"q57o","text":"   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1j9l7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"reagents","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":4524,"mol_weight":0,"name":"Copper (II) chloride dihydrate","linfor":"CuCl2*2H20","url":"","sku":"10125-13-0","cas_number":"","rrid":"","public":1,"can_edit":0,"guid":"FC1926B0E37C11EDAFFC29FF651848A3","entries":null,"vendor":{"id":31,"name":"Fisher Scientific","link":"https://www.fishersci.com/us/en/home.html","is_requested":false,"image":{"source":"/img/vendors/placeholder.png","placeholder":"/img/vendors/placeholder.png"}}}}}}

steps.section: Pour 150mm nursery plates (up to 6 days prior to tracking)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"eksf2","text":"Sterilise by passing through a 0.22 micron syringe filter into a clean microfuge tube wrapped in tinfoil.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Pour 150mm nursery plates (up to 6 days prior to tracking)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"lam4","text":"Once agar has cooled to around 62°C , add the post-autoclave salts and cholesterol (as described in the protocol above).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Pour 150mm nursery plates (up to 6 days prior to tracking)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"6ku5q","text":"Label 4 x pre-sterilised 1L bottles (red screw cap lids from media kitchen) with desired concentration of CuCl₂ to be tested (i.e. 100;75,50;25µM).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fsdkk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ft8pq","text":"Aseptically transfer 1L of NGM to each of these bottles. I recommend doing this in the microbial hood that has been throughly wiped down with 70% EtOH/Distel prior to use.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Pour 150mm nursery plates (up to 6 days prior to tracking)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"evfom","text":"Aseptically add CuCl₂ from stock to desired concentration, if preparing 1L solutions and 1M stock (as above):","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a5g65","text":"100uL stock solution [1M] in 1L NGM = 100µM final conc","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fvpf9","text":"75uL stock in 1L = 75µM","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"66k8d","text":"50uL stock in 1L = 50µM","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dgu6i","text":"25uL stock in 1L = 25µM","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Pour 150mm nursery plates (up to 6 days prior to tracking)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"sea8","text":"Here we want to look for behavioural differences between the mutant and control for the first generation (F1) and second generation (F2) worms reared on various concentrations of copper. Since we will be doing 3 day replicates, we will need 12 x 150 mm plates for each concentration to be tested. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"tpp","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"644gc","text":"Hence, pre-label 12 x 150mm petri dishes (nursery plates) for each concentration of copper.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b0ag0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ftqcn","text":"The remaining 0.5L of NGM will be used for 'no compound/no treatment' control plates (only 6 needed in total). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Pour 150mm nursery plates (up to 6 days prior to tracking)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"1mqs2","text":"Pour 75mL of agar into the respective nursery plates and leave to dry in the hood.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1dn7k","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"5vnai","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"protocols","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"id":24312,"title":"Plate Pouring","title_html":"Plate Pouring","load_collapsed":true,"uri":"plate-pouring-3yygpxw","image":{"source":"https://www.protocols.io/img/default_protocol.png","webp_source":null,"placeholder":"https://www.protocols.io/img/default_protocol.png","webp_placeholder":null},"creator":{"name":"Priota Islam","affiliation":"Imperial College London","affiliation_url":"http://behave.lms.mrc.ac.uk/","username":"priota-islam","link":"https://www.researchgate.net/profile/Priota_Islam","image":{"source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/pr-journal/86b3npn.jpg","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/pr-journal/86b3npn.jpg","webp_source":""}},"stats":{"number_of_steps":3},"type_id":1,"guid":"5E161D20E38011EDAFFC29FF651848A3"}}}}

steps.section: Pour 150mm nursery plates (up to 6 days prior to tracking)

steps.section: Pour tracking plates (up to 4 days prior to tracking)

steps.section: Pour tracking plates (up to 4 days prior to tracking)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"26hgu","text":"Once agar has cooled to around 62°C , add the post-autoclave salts and cholesterol (as described above).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Pour tracking plates (up to 4 days prior to tracking)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"c6dmu","text":"Meanwhile make up fresh stocks of 1M CuCl₂ (as described above).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Dry plates and bleach worms (5 days prior to tracking F1 worms)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"f404g","text":"Dry 2 x 150 mm NGM-agar plates of copper concentration (i.e. 0;25;50;75;100µM, with 1 plates for mutant and control) in the drying cabinet (setting 2) for 3 hours.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Pour tracking plates (up to 4 days prior to tracking)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"f493f","text":"Label 4 x pre-sterilised 250mL bottles (red screw cap lids from media kitchen) with the concentrations of CuCl₂ to be tested (i.e. 100;75,50;25µM).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1p8r8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a0m1v","text":"As above, aseptically transfer 200mL of NGM to each of these bottles and add CuCl₂ to the desired final concentration.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Pour tracking plates (up to 4 days prior to tracking)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"24bq2","text":"Pre-label 9 x tracking plates with each concentration of CuCl₂. This will allow for 3 day replicates of: 4h exposure to excess copper, F1 worms and F2 worms to be tracked on separate plates.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b7a0h","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f00tp","text":"Label 3 x tracking plates as 'NGM only' for the no compound controls. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Pour tracking plates (up to 4 days prior to tracking)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"1accu","text":"Dispense agar into square 96-well plates using VIAFILL dispenser. Dispense 200 µL  per well. steps.section: Dry plates and bleach worms (5 days prior to tracking F1 worms)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"dtejp","text":"Bleach synchronise worms prepared in step 1 and leave in diapause for 2 days at 20°C on a rotator that is constantly spinning.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5e4ji","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"5ct8o","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"protocols","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"id":22617,"title":"Bleach synchronisation of C. elegans","title_html":"Bleach synchronisation of C. elegans","load_collapsed":true,"uri":"bleach-synchronisation-of-c-elegans-2bzgap6","image":{"source":"https://www.protocols.io/img/default_protocol.png","webp_source":null,"placeholder":"https://www.protocols.io/img/default_protocol.png","webp_placeholder":null},"creator":{"name":"Ida Barlow","affiliation":null,"affiliation_url":null,"username":"ida-barlow","link":null,"image":{"source":"/img/avatars/011.png","placeholder":"/img/avatars/011.png","webp_source":""}},"stats":{"number_of_steps":22},"type_id":1,"guid":"22C04E90E38411EDAFFC29FF651848A3"}}}}

steps.section: Dry plates and bleach worms (5 days prior to tracking F1 worms)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"7q359","text":"Seed 150 mm plates with E. coli OP50 and leave to dry on bench at room temperature overnight.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":24,"length":7}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Refeed L1s (3 days prior to tracking F1 worms)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"frhm6","text":"Pre-label the pre-seeded 150mm plates with the relevant strain name and date, i.e. 'N2' or 'cua-1[H828Q]', for each copper concentration, remember to include a no compound control.\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"39bc7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Refeed L1s (3 days prior to tracking F1 worms)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"5scnh","text":"At 16:45, spin L1s (prepared in step 7) for day 1 of tracking using centrifuge program 1 (1500 rpm for 2 mins).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Refeed L1s (3 days prior to tracking F1 worms)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"5ktlh","text":"Use a 3 mL plastic pasteur pipette to carefully remove the supernatant (leaving ~1 mL) then resuspend the worm pellet by gently flicking the tube.\n\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Refeed L1s (3 days prior to tracking F1 worms)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"51d33","text":"At 17:00, use a clean rubber teat and glass pipette per strain, carefully aspirate the L1 worm suspension and drop 4 small droplets onto the bacterial lawn (~1000-1500 worms total) of the pre-seeded/pre-labelled 150mm nursery plates.\n\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Refeed L1s (3 days prior to tracking F1 worms)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"31q2i","text":"Incubate, agar-side down, at 20°C for 15 mins to allow the droplets containing L1 worms to dry.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Refeed L1s (3 days prior to tracking F1 worms)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"9lnav","text":"Flip plates to be agar-side up and incubate at 20°C. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Dry and seed tracking plates (1 day prior to tracking F1 worms)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"e9dud","text":"In the morning, remove 2 x square 96-well tracking plate from the cold room per copper concentration and weigh three random plates without their lids.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1grgt","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Dry and seed tracking plates (1 day prior to tracking F1 worms)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"3olej","text":"Allow plates to dry, with lids off, in the drying cabinet (setting 2) until they have reduced in weight by 3-5% (~1.5 - 2 hours).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Dry and seed tracking plates (1 day prior to tracking F1 worms)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"blgc4","text":"Pre-label dried tracking plates (step 10) with the imaging run and drug information, so that every plate on a single day of imaging has a unique plate id. For example 100µM_F1_run1, where:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5rsce","text":"- '100µM' is the concentration of copper on the plate","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3lbvt","text":"- '_F1' stands for F1 worms reared on copper from the point of refeeding (use '4h' for 4h exposure)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5rtq2","text":"- '_run1' is the imaging run number that day","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Dry and seed tracking plates (1 day prior to tracking F1 worms)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"f00lf","text":"Ensure optical density of E. coli OP50 stock is ~1.0 (an OD of 0.96 - 1.04 is acceptable).\n\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":26,"length":7}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ea7vs","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Tracking F1 worms and worms exposed to excess copper for 4h
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"2vg3m","text":"At 09:00, wash young adult worms off the 150 mm plates using M9 buffer, and a clean 3 mL pasteur pipette per strain, into 15 mL falcons (labelled with strain name and copper treatment).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bh4lf","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Dry and seed tracking plates (1 day prior to tracking F1 worms)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"e7o8h","text":"Use the VIAFILL dispenser to seed all the tracking plates with 5 µL bacterial suspension per well and leave to dry (~20 mins).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Dry and seed tracking plates (1 day prior to tracking F1 worms)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"3a6m8","text":"Flip tracking plates to be agar-side up, cover with an opaque box and leave at room temp overnight.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Tracking F1 worms and worms exposed to excess copper for 4h
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"3p92i","text":"Centrifuge using program 1 (1500 rpm for 2 mins) to pellet the worms.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Tracking F1 worms and worms exposed to excess copper for 4h
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"9t3cf","text":"Carefully remove and discard the supernatent and refill with M9 .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Tracking F1 worms and worms exposed to excess copper for 4h
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"719ui","text":"Repeat steps 33-34.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Tracking F1 worms and worms exposed to excess copper for 4h
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"71kg7","text":"After final wash, fill 15 mL falcon with M9. Transfer contents to a clean 50ml falcon and top up to 45 mL with M9.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Tracking F1 worms and worms exposed to excess copper for 4h
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"6cnm","text":"Use COPAS wormsorter to dispense 3 worms per well (pure, no double) into their respective imaging plates, filling 5 plates at a time.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"854ld","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"ab5qd","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"protocols","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"id":50531,"title":"COPAS wormsorter v.2","title_html":"\u003cp\u003eCOPAS wormsorter v.2\u003c/p\u003e","load_collapsed":true,"uri":"copas-wormsorter-v-2-bvkbn4sn","image":{"source":"https://www.protocols.io/img/default_protocol.png","webp_source":null,"placeholder":"https://www.protocols.io/img/default_protocol.png","webp_placeholder":null},"creator":{"name":"Bonnie Evans","affiliation":null,"affiliation_url":null,"username":"bonnie-evans","link":"","image":{"source":"/img/avatars/013.png","placeholder":"/img/avatars/013.png","webp_source":""}},"stats":{"number_of_steps":66},"type_id":1,"guid":"2E7A4AD0E38711EDAFFC29FF651848A3"}}}}

steps.section: Tracking F1 worms and worms exposed to excess copper for 4h
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"fjm9","text":"To test the effects of exposing worms to copper for 4h simply dispense worms from the NGM only nursery plates into the wells of tracking plates containing the desired concentration of copper. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cndfa","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"637dh","text":"In this experiment I fill half of the plate with WT and half with cua-1[H828Q]","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Tracking F1 worms and worms exposed to excess copper for 4h
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"6rj87","text":"Allow liquid to dry by placing imaging plates in microbial safety cabinet (pre-sterilsed with 70% ethanol) with lids off for ~30 minutes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Tracking F1 worms and worms exposed to excess copper for 4h
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"35na2","text":"Use a microscope to check that wells are dry and incubate, agar-side up, in the 20°C incubator.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Tracking F1 worms and worms exposed to excess copper for 4h
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"68g9t","text":"Track worms incubated on the tracking plates after 4 hours, as calculated from the median point of dispensing worms (middle wormsorter time), and allow worms 30 mins to acclimatise to conditions in the tracking room prior to imaging. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1gu6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9fca3","text":"For example: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bko90","text":"- Wormsorter start time = 10:00","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4csoi","text":"- Wormsorter end time = 10:40","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"euhc2","text":"- Middle wormsorter time = 10:20","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"41ur3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1e6m8","text":"- Place in tracking room at 13:50","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8lt25","text":"- Start imaging run at 14:20","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Tracking F1 worms and worms exposed to excess copper for 4h
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"8cjuu","text":"Image on the multi-camera tracker (Hydra) using 'run_syngenta_experiment_v2.py' protocol script: \n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aha6a","text":"1) 5 min pre-stimulus recording","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fngoi","text":"2) 6 min blue light recording: 60 sec no light, [10 sec light ON, 90 sec light OFF] x 3     (6 min total)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"73b4o","text":"3) 5 min post-stimulus recording","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Preparing F2 worms (Day of tracking F1 worms)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"321go","text":"While tracking plates are drying, recover the 50mL falcon tubes containing worms reared on various copper concentrations and transfer remaining worm suspension to fresh 15mL falcon tubes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"8u734","text":"Prepare nursery plates for rearing the second generation of worms (F2) on increased copper concentrations by repeating steps 17-18. Ensure that you clearly labelled the plates with the concentration of copper, worm strain and generation number.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Preparing F2 worms (Day of tracking F1 worms)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"as0di","text":"Centrifuge using program 1 (1500 rpm for 2 mins) to pellet the worms.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Preparing F2 worms (Day of tracking F1 worms)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"24o4d","text":"Use a 3 mL plastic pasteur pipette to carefully remove the supernatant (leaving ~1 mL) then resuspend the worm pellet by gently flicking the tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Preparing F2 worms (1 day after tracking F1 worms)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"e8scj","text":"The F1 worms refed yesterday will have now laid their eggs onto the F2 nursery plates. Use an eyelash pick to remove these adult worms from the plates, continue incubating the nursery plates at 20°C monitoring their development.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Dry and seed tracking plates (1 day prior to tracking F2 worms)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"6ggbe","text":"Repeat steps 26-31 to prepare plates for tracking the behaviour of the second generation of worms reared on plates containing excess copper.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"3bvhr","text":"Repeat steps 33-42 to track the F2 worms.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
